intro: Aeschynomene elegans, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant has small, oval leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Aeschynomene elegans is also used in some traditional herbal practices.
